statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Eastern Michigan 80, Central Michigan 69
article.story: MOUNT PLEASANT, Mich. (AP) -- John Bowler scored 21 points and grabbed 14 rebounds to lead Eastern Michigan past Central Michigan 80-69 on Wednesday night. The Chippewas (4-22, 1-16 Mid-American) made six of their first eight shots and built a 12-5 lead before Eastern Michigan (7-19, 3-14) went on an 11-0 run to pull ahead. A layup by Sefton Barrett gave the Chippewas a brief 35-34 lead, but the Eagles answered again with another 11-0 run that put Eastern ahead for good. Central Michigan twice cut the lead to four points but could get no closer as the Eagles -- who hit 70.3 percent (26-of-37) from the free-throw line -- made seven straight foul shots at the end. Sefton Barrett led the Chippewas with 29 points, including 26 in the second half, while Chris Kellermann added 15 points and Giordan Watson scored 13. Danny McElhinny scored 21 points for Eastern Michigan -- including 6-of-10 from behind the 3-point line -- while Carlos Medlock added 17 points and Nick Freer scored 11. The Chippewas have lost three straight and 10 of their last 11. Central Michigan is now locked into the 12th, and last, spot in the postseason MAC tournament, which begins Monday. The Eagles are assured the 11th seed.
